p: According to a commonly accepted hierarchy of solutions in waste management, the prevention of waste generation should be the primary solution to be implemented. Alternative actions to be taken include the exploitation of waste for the retrieval of added-value products, an extremely attractive possibility both from an environmental and economic point of view. The actions fit into the overall definition of “biorefinery”, which is the sustainable conversion of biomass into energy and other biobased products [ 2, 3].
